chargeHist.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack Boettcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jack Boettcher is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jack Boettcher was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $600.00.
Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE.
Court ordered Defendant to pay ALL COSTS/FEES, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Court set Restitution at ZERO.
with credit for 3 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes: - No New Law Violations raising to the level of Probable Cause.

- Cooporate with DOC Agent.
- Continue Treatment with the V.A.

- AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatmenT.
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.

supervisions.notes: -Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device.

- Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
- Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

charges.descr: Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (5th or 6th)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jack Boettcher

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jack Boettcher in court with attorney Emily Jane Bell.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded. State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 36 MONTHS, with credit for 3 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 12 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  

Court found Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS NOT ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 
 
EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
-No New Law Violations raising to the level of Probable Cause.
-Cooporate with DOC Agent.
- AODA Assessment, comply with recommended treatment. 
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
- Continue Treatment with the V.A.
- Court ordered defendant's driving privileges REVOKED for 2 YEARS.  
- Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 2 YEARS. Court orders all vehicles owned by the defendant must be equipped with an ignition interlock device.
- Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $600.00.

Court ordered Defendant to provide a DNA SAMPLE and pay DNA SURCHARGE.
Court ordered Defendant to pay ALL COSTS/FEES, payable from Defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the Department of Corrections (DOC). Remainder to be paid during the period of Extended Supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court set Restitution at ZERO.

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: PreTrial Incarceration Credit; Sentencing Referral Form; and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Jack Boettcher in court with attorney Emily Jane Bell.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

AS TO COUNT  2: 
Pursuant to negotiations and on Motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT  2 DISMISSED. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.
Correspondence dated July 5, 2022 from Attorney Emily Bell; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
-received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Jack Boettcher in court with attorney Emily Jane Bell.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jack Boettcher appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom. 
  Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing in Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Jack Boettcher in court with Attorney Emily Jane Bell.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time to review discovery.  Court rescheduled hearing.  Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Enlarge Time to File Motions, filed.

Defendant Jack Boettcher in court with Attorney Emily Jane Bell.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Court took judicial notice of the defendants 5 prior OWI's. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Brown Deer Officer C. Lozano. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Jack Boettcher in court with attorney Emily Jane Bell.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Notice of Retainer

Adjustment Number: 22A 006732,
Payable Number: 980957,
Receipt Number: 22RP003340,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/3/22 @ 1:30p
